item.title: 台币惊人反弹给科技和保险公司带来麻烦
item.description: 台币飙升加剧了人们对作为全球科技供应链中坚力量的本地企业的竞争力和盈利前景的担忧。【原文：A surging Taiwan dollar is aggravating concerns about the competitiveness and earnings prospects of local firms that form the backbone of global tech supply chains.】

item.title: 市场关注中美贸易谈判，石油保持跌势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的言论凸显了官员们在达成可能的协议方面所面临的困难。【原文：Oil held a loss ahead of trade talks between the US and China, with comments from President Donald Trump highlighting the difficult path officials face reaching a possible agreement.】

item.title: NTT 拟 200 亿美元要约收购 NTT 数据公司，打造人工智能支点
item.description: 日本电信电话公司（Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp）计划将 NTT Data Group Corp.【原文：Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. plans to make NTT Data Group Corp. a wholly-owned subsidiary, a move geared at making AI central to the telecom giant’s sprawling operations.】

item.title: Switch 2关税问题考验任天堂股价涨幅纪录
item.description: 任天堂公司（Nintendo Co., Ltd.）破纪录的股价涨势可能在周四面临现实的考验，因为这家娱乐业巨头正试图向投资者保证，尽管美国征收关税，其销售前景依然看好。【原文：Nintendo Co.’s record-breaking stock rally may face a reality check on Thursday as the entertainment giant tries to reassure investors of its sales outlook despite US tariffs.】

item.title: 房产中介称英国房屋销售指数创 2023 年以来新低
item.description: 在房产税上调和唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的贸易战导致购房者纷纷躲避之后，一项受到密切关注的英国住房市场指标骤降至近两年来的最低水平。【原文：A closely watched indicator of the UK housing market plunged to the lowest level in almost two years after a property tax increase and Donald Trump’s trade war sent buyers into hiding.】

item.title: 美国关税给经济增长带来风险，英国央行将转向鸽派
item.description: 由于美国贸易战令经济增长前景暗淡，预计英国央行将于周四将利率下调四分之一个百分点，并可能发出6月份可能再次降息的信号，这有可能使央行自2009年以来首次连续降息。【原文：The Bank of England is expected to cut interest rates by a quarter percentage point Thursday and may signal that another move is likely in June, potentially putting the central bank on course for its first back-to-back reductions since 2009 as the US trade war darkens the outlook for growth.】

item.title: 斯塔默承诺英国工人将从军费增长中获益
item.description: 英国首相基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）表示，英国工人将从英国增加军费开支的计划中受益，因为英国政府正试图说服心存疑虑和不满的选民相信增加国防开支的好处。【原文：Prime Minister Keir Starmer said British workers would benefit from the UK’s plans to boost military spending, as his government tries to convince a skeptical and disgruntled electorate of the merits of increased outlays on defense.】

item.title: 里夫斯将在下一次预算前打破财政规则，增加 570 亿英镑
item.description: 据一家著名经济智库称，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）有望在英国秋季预算案中将其财政规则双双错过数百亿英镑，这使她别无选择，只能增税或削减开支。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is on track to miss both her fiscal rules by tens of billions of pounds in the UK’s autumn budget, according to a prominent economic think tank, leaving her no option but to raise taxes or cut spending.】

item.title: 对印度财报的担忧有所缓解，提振刚刚起步的股市反弹
item.description: 印度最近的一系列企业盈利正在成为另一个积极的催化剂，很可能会帮助印度新生的股市凝聚反弹力量。【原文：India’s recent crop of corporate earnings is emerging as another positive catalyst that’s likely to help its nascent stock-market rally gather steam.】

item.title: 中期投票是菲律宾抵御关税相关风险的关键
item.description: 由于全球贸易战暴露了亚洲增长最快的经济体之一菲律宾的弱点，菲律宾 5 月 12 日的中期选举让投资者对政府政策的任何变化保持警惕。【原文：The Philippines’ May 12 midterm election is putting investors on alert for any changes to government policies, as the global trade war exposes weaknesses in one of Asia’s fastest-growing economies.】

item.title: 鲍威尔称美联储不会仓促行事，前景取决于白宫
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）明确表示，在贸易政策方向更加明朗之前，他不会急于降低借贷成本，而这必须由白宫来决定。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell made clear he won’t be rushed into lowering borrowing costs until there’s more certainty on the direction of trade policy, which will have to come from the White House.】

item.title: 法律间谍战升级，Rippling 和 Deel 聘请新律师
item.description: 市值数十亿美元的人力资源和薪资管理初创公司 Rippling 和 Deel Inc. 都聘请了新的顶级律师，以加强彼此间激烈的法律斗争。【原文：Multibillion-dollar human resources and payroll startups Rippling and Deel Inc. have both hired new top lawyers as they ramp up their high-drama legal battle against each other.】

item.title: 鲍威尔就经济问题安抚投资者，股市上涨：市场综述
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔表示，美国经济依然稳健，央行不会因唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易政策而被迫采取草率行动，股市、国债和美元因此上涨。半导体出口规则放宽的前景支持了芯片制造商。【原文：Stocks, Treasuries and the dollar rose as Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said the US economy remained sound and the central bank won’t be forced into rash action by President Donald Trump’s trade policies. The prospect of looser rules on semiconductor exports supported chipmakers.】

item.title: 日本大亨家族寻求收购以躲避投资者压力
item.description: 丰田章男计划以 420 亿美元收购丰田汽车公司（Toyota Industries Corp.【原文：Akio Toyoda’s $42 billion plan to buyout Toyota Industries Corp. is the most dramatic example of a growing trend in Japan of founding families trying to take companies private.】

item.title: 对冲基金 3,000 万美元薪酬显示日本利率交易员竞争激烈
item.description: 在多年来最大的市场波动造成广泛损失之后，银行和对冲基金纷纷抢购经验丰富的交易员，日元汇率领域的人才争夺战愈演愈烈。【原文：A talent war is intensifying in the yen rates space, as banks and hedge funds snap up seasoned traders after the biggest market swings in years inflicted widespread losses.】

item.title: 从尼克松窥探特朗普的未来
item.description:
尼尔-弗格森（Niall Ferguson）和法里德-扎卡里亚（Fareed Zakaria）与特朗普经济学 一起从历史的角度来看待美国历史上的这一时刻。【原文：

Niall Ferguson and Fareed Zakaria join Trumponomics to offer some historical perspective on this moment in American history.

】

item.title: 巴西将利率上调至 14.75% 的近二十年新高
item.description: 巴西中央银行将其关键利率上调了半个百分点，达到了自 2006 年以来的最高水平，因为决策者们在努力控制高于目标的通货膨胀的同时，也在关注日益恶化的全球经济前景。【原文：Brazil’s central bank increased its key interest rate by a half-point to the highest level since 2006, as policymakers work to tame above-target inflation while also heeding a worsening global economic outlook.】

item.title: 美元下滑，高盛上调美国通胀预期
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Economists at Goldman Sachs Group Inc. boosted their forecasts for US inflation this year and next, in part to account for a weaker dollar following the Trump administration’s tariff announcements.】

item.title: 马斯克的 xAI 将在孟菲斯超级计算机上使用特斯拉电池
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 xAI 公司正在使用特斯拉公司的 Megapack 电池来支撑其位于孟菲斯的 "巨像 "超级计算机，这是马斯克公司之间利益重叠的又一个例子。【原文：Elon Musk’s xAI is using Tesla Inc.’s Megapack batteries to shore up its “Colossus” supercomputer in Memphis, another example of the overlapping interests between Musk’s companies.】

item.title: 私募股权投资将愤怒的贷款人推到了队伍的末尾
item.description:
公司重组潮正在形成一种阶级制度，使债权人损失数十亿美元。就在经济最需要债务投资者的时候，这对他们是一个新的打击。【原文：

A stampede of restructuring companies is creating a class system that's costing creditors billions. It’s a new blow for debt investors just as the economy needs them most.

】

item.title: 埃克森与日本丸红签订低碳氨销售协议
item.description: 埃克森美孚公司签署了一项向丸红公司销售低碳氨的长期协议，这是该公司在得克萨斯州贝敦启动氢气项目的关键一步。【原文：Exxon Mobil Corp. signed a long-term agreement to sell low-carbon ammonia to Marubeni Corp., a crucial step in getting its hydrogen project in Baytown, Texas, off the ground.】

item.title: 马来西亚将抵制提前降息，权衡关税影响
item.description: 马来西亚央行预计将在周四维持利率不变，并可能至少在今年下半年之前保持观望态度，因为马来西亚政府正努力避免美国提高关税。【原文：Malaysia’s central bank is expected to keep interest rates unchanged on Thursday and will likely maintain a wait-and-see approach until at least the second half of the year as the government seeks to avoid higher US tariffs.】

item.title: 仅剩一家炼油厂，旧金山汽油价格上涨
item.description: 瓦莱罗公司的贝尼西亚炼油厂周一发生火灾，导致旧金山湾区只有一家汽油厂仍在运营，在驾车高峰季节到来之前对价格造成压力，并阻碍了州长加文-纽森（Gavin Newsom）为加州人民提供救济的努力。【原文：A fire Monday at Valero’s Benicia refinery leaves only one gasoline plant still operating in the San Francisco Bay Area, putting pressure on prices ahead of peak driving season and stymieing Governor Gavin Newsom’s efforts to offer relief to Californians.】

item.title: 千禧年公司正在与高盛集团的彼得希尔公司商谈股权出售事宜
item.description: 据一位熟悉此事的人士透露，伊兹-英格兰德（Izzy Englander）的千禧年管理公司（Millennium Management）正在与高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Izzy Englander’s Millennium Management is in talks with Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s Petershill unit about helping find buyers to take a minority stake in the hedge fund, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 莱维敦美国反深度伪造法案等待总统下笔
item.description:
《取缔法案》在两党支持下获得众议院通过。Levittown 联合主持人奥利维亚-卡维尔（Olivia Carville）将在本期更新节目中讨论该法案。【原文：

The Take It Down Act passed the House with bipartisan support. Levittown co-host Olivia Carville discusses the legislation in this update episode. 

】

item.title: MercadoLibre 在阿根廷的 "惊人 "反弹超出预期
item.description: 电子商务和金融科技巨头 MercadoLibre 公司今年第一季度的业绩超出了分析师的预期，其信贷组合实现了强劲增长，同时，由于阿根廷取消了贸易壁垒和货币管制，该公司在阿根廷的业务也得到了提升。【原文：E-commerce and fintech giant MercadoLibre Inc. beat analysts’ expectations in the first quarter of the year, delivering strong growth in its credit portfolio while its Argentina division saw a boost as the country removed trade barriers and scrapped currency controls.】

item.title: 各州起诉特朗普停止电动汽车充电器计划
item.description: 加利福尼亚州总检察长表示，该州和其他 16 个州正在起诉唐纳德-特朗普总统暂停一项 50 亿美元的电动汽车充电器联邦资助计划，认为他上任以来削减美国对插电式汽车补贴的指令是非法的。【原文：California’s attorney general said his state and 16 others are suing President Donald Trump for suspending a $5 billion federal funding program for electric car chargers, arguing his directives to slash US subsidies for plug-in vehicles since taking office are unlawful.】

item.title: Arm 预测不温不火，芯片制造商更加谨慎
item.description: Arm Holdings Plc 对本期销售额的预测乏善可陈，称新授权协议的时间安排使这家芯片公司对其预测持谨慎态度。【原文：Arm Holdings Plc gave a lackluster sales forecast for the current period, saying that the timing of new licensing agreements has made the chip company cautious about its predictions.】

item.title: 绿点公司股价因私募股权投资兴趣报告而大涨
item.description: 在《财富》援引未具名银行和私募股权投资公司高管的话报道了这家金融科技公司吸引了私募股权投资兴趣之后，Green Dot 公司的股价最高跃升了 7.3%，创下自 4 月 9 日以来的最大涨幅。【原文：Green Dot Corp. shares jump as much as 7.3%, the most intraday since April 9, after Fortune reported that the financial technology company had attracted private equity interest, citing unnamed banking and PE executives.】

item.title: 美国空军寻求加快交付特朗普的飞机
item.description: 美国空军官员表示，随着唐纳德-特朗普总统对在其第二个任期结束前获得一架重新设计的飞机越来越不耐烦，美国空军正在推动加快交付新的空军一号。【原文：The US Air Force is pushing to speed the delivery of the new Air Force One, service officials said, as President Donald Trump grows more impatient about getting a redesigned plane before his second term ends.】
